Interest rate risk management Interest rate risk is the risk that the Group's financial position will fluctuate due to changes in market interest rates.

The Group’s exposure to the risk of changes in market interest rates relates primarily to financial instruments with floating interest rates including longeterm debt obligations and Cash and shorteterm depOSits. The Group manages its interest rate risk by maintaining an appropriate mix offixed and floating rate debt.
